website_summaries.verdict: The aircraft-grade aluminum handles offer great corrosion resistance for long-term durability and use.
pros: The spring-loaded pliers keep the stainless steel jaws and tungsten carbide cutters open and ready for use with just one hand
The nylon sheath with a belt loop means the pliers are always close by
cons: These are good pliers, but some of them have a tendency to bend when pressure is applied

customer_reviews.title: Good set of pliers
customer_reviews.text: This is the typical run of the mill aluminum fishing pliers. They are spring loaded to keep the jaws open. The line cutter works great for braided line. They are very light in the hand but actually feel decently well made. So far I’ve not had any rust and the jaws have a close to perfect alignment with no flex when twisting a hook out. For the price this is a good set to keep in your box. Is it the best set out there? No.. but do you really need the best set out there? If your not running a charter boat day in and day out then these should do 99% of us just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Scott E.

customer_reviews.title: Great first initial impression
customer_reviews.text: These things look great, feel great, and operate pretty well. I like the blue and aluminum colors match together it matches my car and my gear so that initially was what drew me into this item. The Pliers are nice and Light they function very well. We'll see how they work out on the kayak and I'll get back to you if we have any failures. Update:11/5/28 these are amazing I use them at least once a week still never go fishing without them they removed split rings, trebble hooks and j hooks like magic. I use the cutters on mono and super
customer_reviews.author: 34yo Midwestern Father

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: This fishing pliers is great. Everything I could ask for and the carrying case is a huge plus. I have used it ice fishing several times since I purchased it, and the line cutter at the bottom of the mouth of the pliers is a huge bonus. The slotted clamp for sinkers is also a huge plus. Lastly, the pliers are not at all bulky so seeing your hooks or lure in a fish's mouth is easy!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Johnson

customer_reviews.title: A must buy
customer_reviews.text: My husband received these pliers as a christmas gift and he loves them! They are very well built and has a nice heft to them. My husband loves that they come with a lanyard because it really helps to keep them from falling into the water. They are super Sharpe no problem cutting braided line. Definitely a recommendation from a fisherman!
customer_reviews.author: Susana

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed With Quality
customer_reviews.text: These are sweet! Can't beat the quality in my opinion. Very lightweight, the included lanyard and sheath were very handy. I clipped the lanyard to my kayak seat so no worries about losing. These are so easy to use and I really like how they have interchangeable blades. I'll never have to worry about having a dull pair. I'll be getting another set for my boat and as presents.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C

customer_reviews.title: Amazing fishing pliers for the $$$!!!
customer_reviews.text: I fished hard for the past two days, Tog fishing. And anyone who Togs (blackfishing) knows you are tying and cutting leader and braid a lot. These pliers were great so far. I really like the dehooker tip on the pliers . And the cutters cut braid like butter. I will definitely be ordering a few pairs for Christmas presents. I’m usually the kind of guy who doesn’t buy inexpensive tools, you get what you pay for. These are definitely worth their price!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Miller09

customer_reviews.title: Best Tool on the Boat.
customer_reviews.text: I never really bothered with pliers in all my years of fishing, just used my hands and a pocket knife for most things. That worked fine until I took a real bad hooking and cutting on an angry catfish. After that, I bought this thing to keep handy for those deep or tough hook spots. Well made, lightweight, the clip and chain make it convenient to keep around on a belt loop of tackle box. It's also come in handy for resetting hook rings, cutting lines, and pinching lead. It was so handy that even my anti-fancy-tools father wanted one.
customer_reviews.author: AvidConsumer

customer_reviews.title: I like a good pair of Dikes
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised! Went on a deep sea trip a few days back, and saw a lot of these on the boat, that had been purchased by fellow anglers as well. I was mildly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: It's almost like the fish bite because you have these pliers!
customer_reviews.text: I think the picture speaks for itself! Great pair of fishing pliers. I wish I had a few more pair for my salt water fishing tackle and my boat!
customer_reviews.author: Danny Y.

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pliers!! From what I can tell these are quality pliers, there is no slop or Loose feeling to the handles everything is pretty solid. These will most likely last for years. Has replaceable plier inserts and also replaceable tungsten braid cutters. Tried to cut through some 50 lb spider wire braid withe dyneema that I use for leaders and it was a breeze. The only thing negative that I noticed was the tungsten blade was loose when I got it but it comes with an Allen wrench so I was able to quickly tighten it no biggie. Very impressed well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the pliers so much!
customer_reviews.text: I love these pliers pretty much! The one I have feels super strong and solid. Have been used it for over 6 months and they are amazing. The cutters work on braid, mono, fluorocarbon very well. Cutting them like butter. The tether and sheath are super convenient. The most cool thing is that there is a loop on the back of the sheath. You can tie it to your belt, that would be safer to keep the pliers from dropping into water. The stainless steel jaws are incredibly strong to unhook any fish. Including bass, walleye, muskie, pike etc. Overall, these are high quality fisherman friendly pliers. Best I have ever had. No complaints at all, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: jyfishing

customer_reviews.title: but they should be perfect for helping me rig lines and getting hooks out ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used them much as yet, but they should be perfect for helping me rig lines and getting hooks out of fish! I especially like the fact they are attached to you just in case you drop them and they fit conveniently on your belt in their own nylon pouch.. Thanks for a great product at a great price!!
customer_reviews.author: John Manship

customer_reviews.title: Cheap pliers, bent on First use.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these pliers and got then 2 days ago. They are beyond cheap and not worth even the price. Walmart brand held up better than these. They bent on 1st use, just using them to hold a wire leader together to make a haywire twist. Cheap pliers, stay away
customer_reviews.author: 540mancini

customer_reviews.title: ***EDIT***bends under pressure from 14-19 fish....:(
customer_reviews.text: Other have said that the pliers bend. I found my removable teeth loose, so I lock-tighted them, and thought that was the source. NOPE. The pliers actually bend under pressure (left to right) when catching small saltwater fish (14-19" fish). I was trying to get the hook out and these cheap pliers made the task awful. I wish I could return them but past the return period. Never again.....
customer_reviews.author: XJfan

customer_reviews.title: Complete Garbage
customer_reviews.text: 1st use: Installed split rings on a couple lures. Ended up with chewed up rings which are now spread further than I would like. These pliers weren't easy to use for this task. 2nd use: Removing a hook from a tiny perch. Didn't work. Ended up using my handy dandy needlenose pliers because this pair was a little too bulky to get into his mouth. 3rd use: Using the pliers to open a packaged lure. The little screws fell out and I lost one of the plier tips. Completely useless at this point. Luckily today is the last day I am eligible to return it.
customer_reviews.author: DeeMo

customer_reviews.title: Bent In Half After First Use!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what anyone is using them for but these pliers are NOT for any kind of Saltwater or heavy duty use. I used them fluke/flounder fishing for ONE TRIP and they bent I half. Completely useless. Maybe for 14 inch largemouth and bluegills they’ll work but if you’re in the salt I’d go with something else.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Cannon

customer_reviews.title: split ring openers are a must for spinner and spoon fisherman!
customer_reviews.text: using for a month. They work better than the "indestructible" pliers I also reviewed and returned. They do not have braid cutters that look as sturdy as on my gander mountain titanium pliers but I have not ruined them yet. The reason I bought these is my gander mountain pliers do not have split ring openers and these do. I use need split ring openers a lot in fall and winter fishing to modify and maintain spinners and spoons for trout. The split ring openers on these pliers work like a charm. I will add to this review if I ruin the braid cutters any time soon
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Sean C. Barbour

customer_reviews.title: Not spring loaded
customer_reviews.text: The spring load is joke. I’m wasting my time and resources returning this thing for another one that hopefully works
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Won't Buy Again
customer_reviews.text: Mine were only a year old and the tip came off and laded in the ocean. The company was very nice and has offered to send me a replacement pair. Their supply comes from China and they don't stock any parts here so I have been waiting 3 weeks now and still haven't seen them. They look good but I am not confident with the build or their ability to service what they sell.
customer_reviews.author: LAWRENCE KAPLAN

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but didn't cut braided line
customer_reviews.text: Used these on a couple fishing trips so far and pretty happy with them. I love the lightweight and the coiled lanyard. Kept them in a front pocket and barely knew they were there yet the lanyard was long enough when clipped to a belt loop that they were always available. Only reason for 4 stars is that mine didn't cut braided line cleanly, or at all usually. If you fish mono they're fine, just didn't cut it using 30lb power pro that I have on some reels. Still happy, especially since I mostly fish saltwater and even stainless pliers eventually get stiff and rust up. Will report back later after seeing how they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Love the pliers, wish the holster was a belt clip instead of loop
customer_reviews.text: These are great to have at the ready when fishing. Not only for getting hooks out, but for managing swivels and other precise action requirements. Rust free is nice too since that will happen to any non-purpose driven pair of pliers you throw in the tackle box. My only gripe is the belt attachment on the holster is a loop, making it cumbersome to put on and take off. It would be nice if it were a durable, tight fitting clip instead, so you could remove and attach it to your belt at will. That's the only thing keeping it from being a 5 star product in my eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse R.

customer_reviews.title: NOT corrosion resistant.
customer_reviews.text: First day fishing on the ocean,,used pliers to unhook four fish. when i got home as i usually do i rinse all my equipment with fresh water. i notice a good spot of rust on the silver colored metal making up the tip. a wire brush got it off but what would it be like if i forgot and left the pliers in the case unwashed ?? the pliers are out of the case now because i guess i now need to wash and rinse the case and let it dry also .. :(
customer_reviews.author: ronco

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, high quality pliers
customer_reviews.text: Pliers seem really good quality. This brand makes nice items. I bought their military backpack and I am in love with it. The only thing I didn't like about this pliers was that the holster can only be put on your belt by looping it through. I wish it had a alligator clip to easily clip it onto my pants when I don't have a belt. Just my own problem so I still have it a 5. I just got a alligator clip I had lying around and pushed it into the back of the holster so now it works (DIY)
customer_reviews.author: Travis Simon

customer_reviews.title: Not for medium to heavy duty use
customer_reviews.text: These may work fine for small hooks and fish with thin lips but if you are catching fish with tougher mouths and using bigger hooks these will not suffice. I fish for catfish mainly with Circle Hooks and these pliers twist and bend so much they lose the grip very easily especially if you are using the tip of the pliers which is the whole point of needle nose. I will keep these around as a back up or for utility but they are essentially a waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not solid
customer_reviews.text: used those for 2 weeks on fishing trip , first large split shot , jaws bend 1/16, than after 2 days up to 1/4'' , screw covers foll off after one week , porlly made / glued ,holster NG the velcro strap gets in the way only small good think about this item is light weight , color , ring hook I've got what I'v got , not what I pay 4 Tossed to Kenai River ...sorry was not to happy
customer_reviews.author: Andy Bielecki

customer_reviews.title: Nice and smooth, sturdy and sharp.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, lightweight, well built. Cutting edge is sharp and secure. Plier tips are securely screwed on. Lanyard coil is strong, I whipped around over my head a few times to test it out. Kinda worried about it catching on something it’s so strong. Holster is of good quality and the ring hole is metal lined. Weakest part looks to be the tiny carabiners, I have had a few of the fail quickly, this one has not yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR SALTWATER FISH
customer_reviews.text: NOT FOR SALTWATER. There is a reason the aluminum pliers at bass pro are $20+ than these.......these aren't very sturdy. AS OTHERS HAVE ALUDED TO, the design of the holster/sheath is a PITA! When u have to fiddle with them to get them out....nope..pass!!!! I've used them twice and they are rusting. They aren't thick enough to not twist when u have a big inshore fish (red, trout, spanish). I wouldn't dare use them for offshore. When u try to twist the hook out the pliers do too. For bass, crappie, or bream they're probably great! But not for saltwater. They'll be a great back up pair ill keep in the boat.
customer_reviews.author: Avid fisher

customer_reviews.title: Product does cut braid, with ease
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Lightweight - product does what it states it will, cutting braid which is more difficult - Grip is good - Handles Split rings very easily. - Pouch holder is in great shape Con: Not really an issue, but for these types of items, I am used to them spring out a little more, but it does not affect any of the use for this item. My older ones spread out a little further, so it is just what I am used too, not an issue with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W.

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE:  PLIER JAWS BENT OUT OF ALIGNMENT AS THEY ALL DO .
customer_reviews.text: The pliers seemed solid when i first checked them out , everything was aligned including the jaws . After i attempted to remove a hook out of a small fishes mouth the plier jaws bent out of alignment and in my experience ALL these cheap & even more expensive ones do the same exact thing . Thats by far the biggest problem with all of these "Made in China" fishing pliers , nothing has changed with them , they all do the same exact thing making them useless. Manufacturers need to do twist tests and make sure the jaws stay aligned before releasing them to the market .
customer_reviews.author: sammy

customer_reviews.title: 3 stars for price related to quality
customer_reviews.text: 3 star review for quality related to price, not overall quality. You will probably not find a better pair of fishing pliers for this price. Light, comfortable, aligned, and line cutter is very sharp. Split ring hook is great for changing hardware on lures. They haven’t rusted yet, and I am mostly a saltwater fisherman so we’ll see how long they last, if I get a full year out of them, I’ll be happy for the money spent. If you want pliers that will last a lifetime in saltwater, your spending $200+. Worth the buy. Update: the line cutter is now useless and misaligned and the jaws have trouble opening at times due to some sand inside them.
customer_reviews.author: OutdoorsDad

customer_reviews.title: Great, at first but then ........
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for a year now and they are so dull they won't even cut 15# mono let alone the braid I bought them to cut. Went to their website to see about replacement blades and they are almost $9.00, I only paid 16 for the pliers. Additionally there is some confusion between the Amazon listed description of the pliers and the description of the cutters on the manufacturers website. The Amazon pliers describes: "perfectly adapted to fresh and saltwater", the manufacturer's website description for the cutters states in bright red type: "Note: The cutters is not for saltwater pliers". I would not buy again and I'm not buying the replacement cutters.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Jankowski 23084

customer_reviews.title: Good pliers!
customer_reviews.text: Great! I wouldn't use to cut wire or pencil lead like some traditional fishing pliers, but it does cut line (which some fishing pliers that cut those things aren't very good for). The belt holster is initially not that intuitive (velcro strap for securing the pliers doesn't have much extra material to grab to release the pliers), but was easy to get used to. Doesn't corrode like steel!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Excited to try
customer_reviews.text: I purchased as a stiffer in the Easter basket for my late teenage son. Although he hasn’t had the opportunity to use them yet (covid19), he is excited to give them try once they stock our rivers. This the reason for 4 stars-they seem good, Easy to hold & the attachment/cord will give easy access when needed. After use, I will adjust my rating to suit the product.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Stark

customer_reviews.title: Average. They twist when removing a hook.
customer_reviews.text: I feel these are very average pliers. I was disappointed when I tried to remove some hooks that were were beyond a simple corner of the mouth hook set. The two halves of the pliers twisted in relation to each other when I tried to twist out some hooks. I had to revert to my old needle-nosed pliers. I haven't tried using them on split rings yet, but wanted to leave this review while leaving a review for another product.
customer_reviews.author: RubberDouggie

customer_reviews.title: Great for Kayak Fishing
customer_reviews.text: Saw these on Ish With Fish's review on YouTube. I mainly do kayak fishing, so these are constantly exposed to corrosive saltwater. So far they have held up really well, and I love that the pliers have spring action. The line cutting blades are razor sharp and cut any mono or braid with ease. If you're looking for a quality set of saltwater fishing pliers, these are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of pliers!
customer_reviews.text: I first saw this when I went on a charter boat and the person next to me was pulling out hooks and getting back in the water so fast. I was so impressed I ended up paying the extra for pliers. While not the most exciting tool to boast about while fishing, I was very hyped and it's definitely worth it. They're extremely light, have the holster or you can just use the carabiner with the cable from my backpack side pocket. They're the perfect size in my hand and have a solid grip on the tips. I have a lot easier time removing hooks!
customer_reviews.author: J. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Big Improvement Over Other Pliers
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased these pliers as a replacement for a pair that was ending it’s useful service life They arrived on the day I was leaving for a three day fishing trip so I took them with me I used them to cut braided and monofilament line and removed the hooks from Fish. This is the first pair of fishing pliers I’ve had that was able to cut braided line easily. They’re a good size approach works very well and overall I am extremely happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Winters

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for about a Month
customer_reviews.text: After about a month of fishing, the braid cutter stopped cleanly cutting braided line. Cutting braid was the main reason I purchased these and now when I try to cut braid it takes several tries and frays the part that is cut. If you are looking for something to cut your braided line, I'd suggest going with another product.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Hill

customer_reviews.title: Cut braided line like butter!  Customer service is an A+
customer_reviews.text: This is just an amazing fishing tool, the braided line cutter cuts braid like butter effortlessly. Actually I bought this pair of pliers more than two months ago, loved it, but then I accidentally cut coper swivel. I sent an email to customer service, they sent me the cutter replacement parts and I have used it every week for the last 5 weeks, it still working effortlessly. This is simply the best fishing tool that I have seen and used so far. Richard
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after the first few uses
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for my husband for Father’s Day. He was super excited at first when he received it and he was happy with how well they cut. At first. Then they stopped cutting. I would like to just be able to ship them back and receive a refund but they don’t offer free returns only if you replace it with the same item
customer_reviews.author: David Miclea

customer_reviews.title: These fishing pliers are great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a replacement for needle nose and diagonal cutter fishing pliers set that I lost over the side, (due to the spring clip slipping off my belt). Love that these pliers eliminate the need for a second set of diagonal cutter pliers since the one pair of pliers provides all the features I need. Love the split ring opener on the tip. Very handy! Also, love the loop rather than a clip on the holder and a lanyard to add security and avoid loss. Overall an amazing value!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Not strong enough. I am still better off with regular nose pliers.
customer_reviews.text: Works well, except for removing hooks. Not strong enough to withstand any twisting of the tip (necessary for removing a hook). Did not work well as an all around tool to replace regular nose pliers from hardware store and a swiss knife. That said, it has a place in the fishing box, just not on the vest.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last a day of use.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy these. These pliers seem like a solid product but don’t be fooled. I bought them for a trip to northern Wisconsin to use for getting hooks out of Pike and Muskie but they didn’t last a day of use. One of the jaws already got bent and now they don’t close properly. I bought these because they were cheap but I will definitely spend the extra money to get a quality product next time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: don't cut anymore
customer_reviews.text: I really do like this company and have bought lots of fishing gear from Pscifun. However, these pliers just didn't hold up. They cut line (mono and braid) pretty well initially. However, after just a few outings they no longer cut braid or mono well at all. I can't even use them for cutting.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Sharp as hell
customer_reviews.text: I was doubtful that this cutter would be as high quality as it was! I was able to cut braid with very little prrssure, thus thing is a tank!! The only improvement I would have asked for is a clip so you can slide it over your belt, the holder only comes with a loop to go through your belt, which is a pain. I bought a different holster for it, so I could move it from my belt to my tactical pack quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Moon

customer_reviews.title: Best fishing pliers hands down!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best fishing pliers made right now. They are super light weight, just the right size, and work perfectly. They cut line with a very light squeeze of the handle, crimp sinkers on the lines for extra weight under a slip bobber, and have a very nice grip to get hooks out of a fish’s mouth. The sleeve it comes in can be hooked to your fishing bag, waist, or the clip can be used to hook them anywhere that is convenient for the angler.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Mull

customer_reviews.title: Need fishing pliers? These are perfect.
customer_reviews.text: These fishing pliers are not very expensive and get the job done well. The blades for cutting fishing line are amazingly effective. It beats carrying nail clippers (or using your teeth...). The pliers spring open automatically which is great, I just wish they sprung open with a bit more force. That's my only complaint, but overall these were exactly what I was looking for. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: beina

customer_reviews.title: Little Allen wrench included
customer_reviews.text: I havent used the pliers yet but they seem good quality for the price point. They also include a small Allen wrench to change or tighten the jaw inserts. I know many complained they there was no way to tighten. Looks like they got the message and now enclose a stubby Allen key tool. It would be nice if the holster added a spot to hold the Allen key so it doesn’t get lost. These are going to live an abused life on the boat with little care so if they last 2 years without a good rinse I will be pleased. Will follow up some day with a report...
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: Salt water worthy
customer_reviews.text: Great fishing pliers for salt water fishing. Only two issues maybe three. Feel like all these fishing pliers experienced the same problem when it comes to the blade for cutting line. They all overtime wear out too quick or become loose. I’ve adjusted them couple of times. Not my main line snips but they do if anything. Just notice the back plate fell off. Honestly thought it was part of the main hinge. Just for show I guess. Last issue is the clip. Might as week throw it out.
customer_reviews.author: Reynaldo Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to get the split rings opened if you know ...
customer_reviews.text: Product works very will. Very easy to get the split rings opened if you know how to use it. Sometimes, you open the split rings to far open however, and the split rings end up permanently leaving the gap though. Just have to be careful how much you open it. Only negative feed back, it's not a heavy duty plier. When trying to thread your lure through the split ring while keeping the split ring opened with the pliers, you tend to grab the split ring with your pliers and it causes permanent damage and alignment issues on the plier's tip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good pliers with a handy case
customer_reviews.text: I bought these without even realizing they came with a belt case. The pliers themselves are solid feeling in the hand, and don't have any sort of flimsy or flexy feel in use. Already pulled a few trebles from pike jaws with them this year and the only criticism I have is that the jaws are a little stubbier than I'd like.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: A fishing necessity
customer_reviews.text: Great for removing hooks from fish and cutting lines- two of my biggest needs when I’m fishing . This set up comes with a sheath and a lanyard- which is a terrific bonus,,,no more looking for where o left the pliers. Cheers and good luck fishing!
customer_reviews.author: iamnoman

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I took these for on a trip to the coast. First the jaws bent. Then the carabiner clip broke as I was reaching for them - nearly a dunked 'em. On day four, cutting the braid or mono required two closures. Thankfully Amazon return policy allows for me to return the broken carabiner and bent pliers.
customer_reviews.author: GoCart Mozart

customer_reviews.title: Great Pliers that easily cuts braid
customer_reviews.text: I needed some new pliers for saltwater rockcod fishing. These are light, stylish, and easily cut braided line. That's all I was really looking for and these perform flawlessly. The jaws are small enough to easily pinch barbs down to a #10 hook but smaller hooks would be difficult. The plier sheath and lanyard that came with it have proven crucial to not losing them. I would buy these again and recommend them to anybody looking for a medium sized set of fishing pliers.
customer_reviews.author: ERIC

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, compare to Booms.
customer_reviews.text: These are nice, but for the same money, maybe less, you can get the Booms X1. Now these are more compact than the Booms. This seem like good quality but not special. More work-man like. Side by side I like the Booms better but you might like these. For heck sakes, they’re under $20, just buy both. That’s what I did.
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last more than a few fishing trips.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this June 12 and the screws kept backing out. Eventually durning my last fishing trip they came out while releasing a fish and one of the screws fell in the water. I had bought a similar set for my boys stockings at Christmas, but they were flimsy and broke after a few uses, so I bought one of these to see if it would hold up to no avail. Would really be nice to find a pair that lasts a few seasons.
customer_reviews.author: CKayB01

customer_reviews.title: The cheaper model is not as good
customer_reviews.text: I buy both the cheap model (~$20) and the expensive one (~30). I like both of them, however, the smaller model is not as sturdy - the blade fall off after a snapper fishing trip. If you intended to use for Bluegills or small fish, it may be OK. I would not recommend this for handling bigger fish. Use the bigger model.
customer_reviews.author: phuongph

customer_reviews.title: Buy the pliers get the holster for free.
customer_reviews.text: Love these pliers. Used them for the first time fishing yesterday and was very impressed. Line cutters worked amazing and they are light and easy to use. Love the tether as well. The holster is cheap and awkward. Belt loop is in the wrong place and they sit really high on your hip. And the strap that holds them in is worthless as it just ends up inside and behind the pliers every time you reholster. Luckily the spring in the pliers holds them in place fairly well. Only reason for the 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Prince

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my nephew for a gift and he finally got to use it last weekend. It really came in handy when stringing his pole, I was told it cuts line nicely. It was also a perfect tool when my nephew needed to remove a 24 in 10lb channel catfish from his line!!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Fallon

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made fishing pliers. Thought I would save some money and get these as a second pair, I have an almost identical pair made by p line that I've had for years. First day these bent while removing a hook from a fish. Nothing very hard either, something I've done hundreds of times with my other pair and they still work good. Line cutting blades move and don't work like they're supposed to either
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Find!
customer_reviews.text: Just wow! Many tackles, along with many pliers. From freshwater to salt water fishing,I have to say hands down on these pliers! One of the best pliers I’ve came across. The only thing is the safety line gets in the way a bit, but you can remove it. Over all one of my favorite tackle items!
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: So sharp. Ridiculously sharp.
customer_reviews.text: These things slice through braid like it's human hair. Blades are offset so you can trim very close to the knot. The various jaw features are quite handy for a variety of tasks. I will probably buy more to give as gifts to my fishing friends.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan and Ruth Brown

customer_reviews.title: nice tool
customer_reviews.text: i use it, cuts braid no problem, light weight. one bad thing about it, it has no catch to keep it closed, so it will be not easy to put it away with one hand. otherwise best fishing pliers i ever had. no rust by the way after many salt water use
customer_reviews.author: Kostik

customer_reviews.title: Piscifum Fishing Pliers ,  yes !
customer_reviews.text: These fishing pliers are a dream to use. Mutifunction is wright,they can do it all and look great going it. I have other fishing pliers that are similar tho not near as well made as these are. I will be ordering these again. They are better than others costing much more. Thanks, Tom
customer_reviews.author: D. T. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Solid weight, well made!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect pliers for fishing. My daughter and I went camping and fishing and I used these pliers all day as she caught 16 fish! The line cutters were razor sharp and the grip was flawless. I didn’t realize how cheap my other pliers were till I felt this pair in my hands. Nice heavyweight feel but not too heavy. 5 stars for me.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for cutting braid!
customer_reviews.text: These are very good overall. Most fishing pliers are not good for cutting braid line but these work exceptionally well. The split pliers also work very well when changing out hooks, attaching weights to line, etc. A non-slip coating on the handles would be nice as these do get a little slick when wet. It should also be noted that the cutting blades are slightly recessed so it can be a little difficult to clip tag ends close to the knot in cases where you are attaching a flouro or mono leader to braided line.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S

customer_reviews.title: Need back up pliers with these.
customer_reviews.text: These pliers are stout and short. You'll need long needle nose if you attempt you remove hooks behind the gills if the fish swallows the hook. Don't kill him if it's too much trouble tho. I do not like how Slick they are. I have take sand paper to the handles and sprayed them with a rubber Matt finish. It's like a tough liner that's not slippery of hard on the hands. Much better now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good pliers bad braid cutters
customer_reviews.text: The pliers are good for the price point, the cutters don’t work well for braid. I caught a Spanish Mackerel that swallowed the hook and I slightly bent the pliers removing the hook. I was able to bend them back into shape
customer_reviews.author: BRIAN PELUSO

customer_reviews.title: Weekend warrior special. Not for commercial use.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. If you try to remove a hook, the pliers will literally fold and be unable to do the job. This item is intended for the weekend warrior that has all day to remove a hook. As a commercial fisherman, we have to get it out so we can get it back into the water as soon as possible. My hands are stronger and better than this loose, low quality item. I’m sticking to my stainless pliers.
customer_reviews.author: Craig J Yoneshige

customer_reviews.title: sturdy construction and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Just got them in yesterday and haven't used them on the water yet but I have been playing with them. Sharp line cutter and sturdy construction, no wiggle in the handle joints, comfortable to hold and easy to shift around without dropping. Comes with a retaining cord and a belt pouch both of which aren't the greatest materials but will easily do the job. Surprisingly it also comes with an Allen key to chance out the cutting blades and jaws if they become damaged or worn. Just wish it came in red or orange colors, those are easier to see in low light or in a tackle bag. I will update after I beat these to death fishing in saltwater.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Buy these you will use them more than you think
customer_reviews.text: I love having these on my hip while fishing. Way better than my nail clippers I was using. Plus these do so much more I didn’t realize, how much I would use them. Turned out to be a great tools for the arsenal
customer_reviews.author: Rhett

customer_reviews.title: line cutter useless
customer_reviews.text: brought this for the plier and the line cutter combo and its the longest plier out there. tried to use the line cutting and it doesnt cut, the only time it can cut is when you have tension on the line. i brought a kastking plier and tried their line cutting it cut like butter.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: almost good quality pliers
customer_reviews.text: It wouldn't take much more effort to make it a great quality product. On about 6th fishing trip with me the bolt comes off with the line cutting blade. Never found where it went. Lost one of three functions to it. Could've maybe tourqe the bolts better and use some thread lock. Eventually center cap that is poorly glued flies out. And i haven't had them for that long. If you need the just to pull hooks out of the mouth or change out rings they're great pliers.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Popov

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for boat fishing
customer_reviews.text: I have used most of the features of the pliers and they work well. I like the cord, so if I have to use both hands quickly, I can just drop the pliers and they stay with me. The size is good in that they are large enough to get the job done but light and easily placed back in the pouch attached to my belt. Fits my hand. I am a 6' male.
customer_reviews.author: Jayhawk

customer_reviews.title: Great pliers
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about them, got a pair in my boat, ice fishing bucket and my tackle box for shore fishing. I don’t use the holster or the bungee cord, those two items are blatantly cheap. But the pliers themselves are top notch.
customer_reviews.author: KJD

customer_reviews.title: Hit or miss?
customer_reviews.text: I like the end part of the pliers, they're built very strong. The pair I received weren't as good as previous piscifun pliers in that the auto-opening spring is malfunctioning. I tried oil, and working it, but they're just not opening by themselves correctly. I probably just got a bad pair.
customer_reviews.author: Monotone Adventures

customer_reviews.title: Good pliers, minor design flaw
customer_reviews.text: Held up in the surf. Took extra care to wipe them down so they didn't accumulate salt and rust. only issue is the very nose of the pliers. Its hooked and kind of gets in the way when trying to pull a hook out. Ill be looking for a set without that feature for my next pair.
customer_reviews.author: Jnmugno

customer_reviews.title: Every Angler Needs One
customer_reviews.text: A great multi-use tool that should be in every angler's tackle box. Unique design and functionality by a company that understands what anglers need. Easy-to-use and store in its carrying case is a must have for the serious and not-so-serious angler.
customer_reviews.author: Rick J. Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: Good pliers, slacks lock.
customer_reviews.text: I must confess bought four today. The pliers all seem to be of the same quality, the deal breaker for me on this one is the lack of locking ability. A compliment on the hex key to work on them.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: Total junk... Recieved on Friday and used for the first time on Sunday... Screws that hold the jaws to pliers were stripped out and jaws broke... The pliers are a poor design... Look good,but stay away
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Pliers I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered several pairs of pliers for me and family members. There are by far my favorites. SOme other ones I have are a little too big for my average sized hands. These fit perfect. LIghtweight and easy to hold. They are a pleasure to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Husband loves these!
customer_reviews.text: After hearing complain over and over again about his normal tool pliers getting rusty so quick with fishing, I got him these for Christmas. I can't count the many times he has told me how good these are. Great choice by the Wife! :)
customer_reviews.author: Karen Beach

customer_reviews.title: Great set of fishing pliers.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best set of pliers I have for fishing. It has multi functions ie crimping, cutting, a beak for prying open o-rings, ect. It's lite, fits great in my hand and it's corrosion resistence is better than any other pliers I'ver had. Only one problem, because it's aluminum, it will deform when heavily torques side to side. However, I was able to bend it back to it's proper shape and now know NOT to put too much torqueing pressure on it. NOT a deal break but something to consider. All in all my favorite fishing pliers.
customer_reviews.author: Drago H Kahanu

customer_reviews.title: Piscifun Aluminium fishing pliers
customer_reviews.text: What I like about this Piscifun pliers is it's rigid with no flex, light weight, grip feels great in your hand, doesn't rust and comes with lanyard and sheath. Great product and price. ✌👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Ika strip

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for your tackle bag
customer_reviews.text: These pliers seem solidly built while not being overly heavy. The attached lanyard and sheath made it great for taking out on the kayak and readily available when I needed them. The line cutters on these are also very sharp and cut through fishing line with no effort at all (10lb mono). I am quite happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joe P.

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Fishing Tool
customer_reviews.text: For the money, and these fishing pliers are very good! You can use the from everything nipping your line, to extracting hook from fish... Big thumbs up... Love the cord that comes with it too.. very useful....
customer_reviews.author: fishingnut26

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: Got these pliers few weeks ago. Used them for first time today. I was amazed at how light weight they were and how they cut thru braid like butter. Also cut 50 pound line with ease. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Mattoc24

customer_reviews.title: I will stick with my needle nose pliers
customer_reviews.text: Pliers look good. They have no way to keep them closed when taken out of sheath, I like to carry my pliers in my pocket, hard to do with pliers open all the way, should be a clip to keep them in closed position. First time used and the end of them twisted. Not very sturdy. Will go back to my needle nose pliers. Just e-mailed company will see what they say??
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to much higher priced options
customer_reviews.text: I picked these up after different pair grew legs and wandered off. Design is nice and neat and the lanyard is a nice touch so keep it secure. I was skeptical about the cutting faces on the clippers but it cleanly cuts my various Suffix 832 lines from 20-50lbs and nips through flouro and mono leader material. Split ring pliers work as intended and do a nice job when you need to change out hooks. I typically keep a pair of hemostats on me for hook removal but the keyed jaws work well in a pinch. Recommend these if you're looking for a budget set of pliers/cutters and don't want to break the bank. Quality is excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dane K.

customer_reviews.title: No twist strength. Garbage pliers.
customer_reviews.text: These pliers are cheap. They have no strength what so ever. They can not be used to bend or twist anything. They are themselves incredibly easy to bend and destroy. 100% will never purchase these or any pliers like these ever again. Absolute garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Austin I

customer_reviews.title: great pliers
customer_reviews.text: There's really nothing to dislike, these pliers are great for all around use. I have experienced no problems even with heavy saltwater use thanks to being built out of aluminum.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Piper

customer_reviews.title: So far, great
customer_reviews.text: Looks and feels sturdy yet remains easy to handle. Love the clip and laynard, being hands free out and having gear on you out at the coast comes in handy. I'll update later after I've used it for fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Jennarator

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: These are flimsy -- bent beyond useful in removing a hook from a five pound catfish. I am back to using needle-nose pliers. They rust, but at least they remain in shape.
customer_reviews.author: Peter D.

customer_reviews.title: My first and last fishing plier
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product,. Cuts braid good and use as a plier is good. Light and comfortable. The piece used to clip the item to self or wherever is junk. Had to replace that. But overall very good.
customer_reviews.author: pooky maliboo

customer_reviews.title: Functional and priced right
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, happy to have a line cutter built in. Remove hooks, open and close weights, cut line and open a bottle of beer while you’re at it. I wish you didn’t need the holder to keep them closed but I like the functionality and the looks as well. This is a pretty great all in one tool for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Moran

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Fishing Pliers
customer_reviews.text: There are tons of options out in cyberspace for fishing pliers. I wanted something that I could depend on working when I needed it. I found it! These pliers look great, feel great and work just very well. They are very well made and come with a sheath that can be worn on your belt. They are lite, feel good in your hands and you have all the tools you need in one plier. Do yourself a favor and buy these, you will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Dude.

customer_reviews.title: Best fishing pliers I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Great Design -- good use of rugged & durable stainless jaws and lightweight aluminum handles make these pliers the best I have ever owned. A must for every well-equipped tackle box.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Broken after second use
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for my husband for father’s day. My husband has used them two times and on the second time, while removing a hook from a small shark they bent at the hinge. He said he would have really liked them had they not broken so easily. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: lauren

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressive and Responsive Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: I experienced a challenge with my pliers with the alignment of the jaws. I successfully contacted Justin and Cathy at the Piscifun customer service number and they immediately arranged to send me a new pair. Justin reassured me that this was an unusual occurrence and that he has had wonderful luck with all four of his pliers. I am eager to try the new set that they will send me at no charge. Thanks Justin and Cathy.
customer_reviews.author: J. B.

customer_reviews.title: Pliers
customer_reviews.text: more pliers to replace my old ones. I like to use different ones to see how well they hold up. Many aluminum pliers will warp. Time will tell how well they hold up
customer_reviews.author: phi

product_meta.title: Piscifun Aluminum Fishing Pliers Braid Cutters Split Ring Pliers Hook Remover Fish Holder with Sheath and Lanyard
feature_bullets: Add Piscifun fishing pliers to your fishing arsenal. Make your hook removal much easier. Fish on!

Anti-Corrosion Aluminum - The aircraft-grade anodized aluminum delivers excellent corrosion resistance, great for long term use without any signs of oxidation and rust. CNC cut handles offer extreme light feeling and durability.

Spring Loaded Pliers - Keeps the pliers open freely, super easy to use by one hand. The titanium coated stainless steel jaws come with split ring tip, strong enough for removing hooks and splitting rings.

Tungsten Carbide Cutters - The Sharpest Tungsten Carbide Cutters (which are fully replaceable) of any pliers on the market, make it extremely easy to cut the strongest braided lines, the heaviest mono leader, the fly lines and backing lines.

Excellent Carrying Around Pliers - Come with Nylon Sheath, Coiled Lanyard and Belt Loop Clasp makes the pliers extremely convenient to carry around and secure with you. The Belt Loop on the back of the sheath makes it safer when being attached to the belt.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
